{"step_by_step_thinking": "Axonal transport refers to the movement of materials to and from a neuron's cell body through the cytoplasm of its axon. It can occur in two directions: anterograde (away from the cell body) and retrograde (towards the cell body). The relevant documents mention both anterograde and retrograde transport. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Antegrade and retrograde.", "answer_choice": "C. Antegrade and retrograde"}
